definition: to swear to God/to cross one's heart
incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb

sentences.english: She was swearing for four hours, ” Michnik says.
sentences.chinese: 她赌咒发誓了4个小时，”米奇尼可说。

sentences.english: When my love swears that she is made of truth.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱人赌咒说她真心一片。

sentences.english: He took an oath that he had seen the defendant leaving the scene of crime.
sentences.chinese: 他赌咒曾看到过被告从犯罪现场离开。

sentences.english: It's my work, girl, I swear I'm trying.
sentences.chinese: 这是我的任务，女孩，我赌咒我曾经在实验。

sentences.english: He was shocked to hear his daughter swearing.
sentences.chinese: 听到他女儿赌咒，他甚为震惊。

sentences.english: The cowardly cow vows not to tow vowels.
sentences.chinese: 害怕的母牛赌咒不拖元音字母。

sentences.english: RenShun was ShangYu words hurt, she swear must win.
sentences.chinese: 仁顺被尚宇的话受伤，她赌咒一定要胜利。

sentences.english: I swear I'll never fail you again.
sentences.chinese: 我赌咒我绝不会再让你绝望。

sentences.english: He swears he knew nothing of this Norwood business.
sentences.chinese: 他还赌咒说他对诺伍德的惨案一点也不知道。

definition: lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
to scold without end (idiom); incessant abuse
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
